body:
AP Photo
By David Cohen
7/19/15 1:30 PM EDT
Updated 7/19/15 1:52 PM EDT
Former President George H.W. Bush has been released from a Maine hospital.
Bush spokesman Jim McGrath tweeted Sunday: “A very grateful President @GeorgeHWBush was discharged today from @MaineMed after four days of treatment for a fractured vertebrae.”
Story Continued Below
On Wednesday, the 91-year-old former president was admitted to the hospital after falling at his home in Kennebunkport and breaking a bone in his neck. He was treated at the Maine Medical Center in Portland.
According to a statement released Thursday by Bush’s office: “The president never lost consciousness, and the injury he sustained neither impinged on his spine nor resulted in any neurological deficits.”
Bush, the nation's oldest living former president, is the father of former President George W. Bush and also of Jeb Bush, a 2016 Republican presidential candidate.
By DEBRA BRUNO
By ROBERT DALLEK
By COLIN WOODARD
By JOSH ZEITZ
© 2015 POLITICO LLC
description: He had been injured in a fall Wednesday.
title: George H.W. Bush released from hospital
